heading: cisco pays $65 million for cocom
subheading: the computer networking company buys copenhagen's cocom to expand its delivery of broadband access products.
author: reuters
text: cisco systems, the world's largest maker of computer networking equipment, said wednesday it would acquire closely held internet access provider cocom a/s of copenhagen for us$65.6 million in stock. cisco said the acquisition was made in an effort to expand its delivery of broadband access products by adding digital video broadcasting solutions to cisco's cable portfolio.cisco shares closed at 72-25/26 on tuesday on the nasdaq stock market.cocom develops high-speed internet access solutions over cable, satellite, and wireless networks.the deal calls for an exchange of $65.6 million of cisco common stock for all outstanding shares and warrants of cocom.the acquisition will be accounted for as a pooling of interests and is expected to close in the first quarter of cisco's fiscal year ending july 2000.the acquisition was approved by each of the company's board of directors and is subject to various closing conditions.cocom's products are based on the dvb standard, which in turn complements existing standard-based cable product portfolio, the company said.cocom's 66 employees will continue to operate in copenhagen and will become part of the cable products and solutions group within cisco's service provider line of business.copyright
